The work in this file was inspired by [this YouTube video](https://www.youtube.com/embed/nlcZcWJiyX8/) by SÃ©rgio Costa.

Load packages
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(sf)
```

Read MN counties data.  The file was download it from the Geographic Information Systems webpage of Minnesota Legislature website [here](https://www.gis.lcc.mn.gov/html/download.html) under the Administrative Boundaries section > Counties, Year 2010 > Download > Shapefile. The page was found via a Google search using the term `shape file for minnesota`.  The search could have been done using the term `geojson minnesota` instead.
```{r}
mn <- read_sf("./county2010/", "county2010")
```

Plot the data using base R
```{r}
plot(mn, max.plot = 26)
```


Explore data
```{r}
head(mn)
```

```{r}
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = mn, aes(fill = POPULATION), color='transparent') +
  geom_sf(data = mn, fill='transparent', color = 'white') +
  scale_fill_viridis_b() +
  theme_void()
```
